gurmukhi: XO suin kY iqh kI bqIXw qb hI ieh caudh lok bnwey ] jIv jnwvr dyv inswcr BIq ky bIc ilKy icq lwey ]
transliteration: Yau Soun(i) Kai Tih Kibateeyaa Tab Hieh Chaudah Lok Banaae|| Jeev Janaavat Dev Nisaachar Bheet Ke Beech Likhhe Chit Laae||
translation: Hearing her words, this friend created all the fourteen worlds and created all the beings, the gods and other;

gurmukhi: Aaur sBY rcnw jghUM kI ilKI kih lau kib sXwm sunwey ] qau ieh Awie smu`Cq kY bhIXwN gih Xw sB hI drswey ]2198]
transliteration: Aur Sabhai Rachnaa Jag-hoon Kilikhikah(i) Lau Kabi Syaam Sounaae|| Tau Eh Aae Samouchchhat Kai Baheeyaan Gadh Yaa Sabh Hidarsaae||2198||
translation: She made all the creation of the world; now she caught hold of the arm of Usha and showed her everything.2198.

gurmukhi: jau bhIAwN gih kY ieh kI aun icqR sBY ieh kY drswey ] dyKiq dyKiq gI iqh TwN jh dÍwrvqI biRjnwQ bnwey ]
transliteration: Jau Baheeaan Gadh Kai Eh Kioun Chitra Sabhai Eh Kai Darsaae Dekhat(i) Dekhat(i) Gitih Thaan Jah Dvaaratibrijnaath Banaae||
translation: When catching her arm, she showed her all the portraits, then seeing all this she reached the Dwarka city of Krishna;

gurmukhi: sMbr kuAir Qo ijh Taur ilKXo ieh qw ipK nYn invwey ] qw suie dyK khXo ieh BwNiq shI myry pRIqm ey sKI pwey ]2199]
transliteration: Sanbar Kuar(i) Tho Jih Thaur Likhyo Eh Taa Pikh Nain Nivaae|| Taa Sue Dekh Kahyo Eh Bhaant(i) Sahidere Preetam E Sakhipaae||2199||
translation: The place where Shamber Kumar was written, she drooped her eyes on reaching there and said, “O friend ! he is my beloved.”2199.

gurmukhi: khXo sKI Ab FIl n kIjY ] pRIqm muih imlwie kY dIjY ] jb sjnI ieh kwrj kY ho ] jIv dwn qb mokhu dY ho ]2200]
transliteration: Kahyo Sakhiab Dheel Na Keejai|| Preetam Muhe Milaae Kai Deejai|| Jab Sajnieh Kaaraj Kai Ho|| Jeev Daan Tab Mokoh Dai Ho||2200||
translation: She said, “O friend ! now don’t delay and cause to meet me with my beloved. O friend! if you execute this task, then consider it resuscitated that my life shall be revived.”2200.’

gurmukhi: XO bqIXw suin kY BeI cIl clI auf dÍwrvqI mih AweI ] pOqR huqo ijh sXwm jU ko iCp sXwm BnY iqh bwq sunweI ]
transliteration: Yau Bateeyaa Soun(i) Kai Bhaicheel Ud Dvaarvatimaih Aaee|| Paoutra Houto Jih Syaam Joo Ko Chhip Syaam Bhanai Tih Baat Sounaaee||
translation: Hearing these words of Usha, she transformed herself into a kite and flew; she reached in Dwarka city; there she told everything to the son of Krishna, while concealing herself,

gurmukhi: eyk qRIXw AtkI qum pY quih lXwieby ky ihq hauhUM pTweI ] qw qy qh byg bulwie ilau myt sBY icq kI duicqweI ]2201]
transliteration: Ek Treevyaa Atkitoum Pai Tuh(i) Lyaae-be Ke Hit Hauhoon Pathaaee|| Taa Te Tah Beg Bulaae Lio Met Sabhai Chit Kidouchitaaee||2201||
translation: “One woman is absorbed in your love and I have come to take you there for her; therefore in order to end the agitation of the mind, go with me there immediately.”2201.

gurmukhi: bYn sunwie kY sXwm BnY iqh Awpno rUp pRq`C dKwXo ] jo qRIX mo pr hY AtkI iqh jwih ipKoN mn Xwih luBwXo ]
transliteration: Bain Sounaae Kai Syaam Bhanai Tih Aapano Roop Pratachchh Dakaayo|| Jo Treeya Mo Par Hai Atkitih Jaah(i) Pikhon Man Yaah(i) Loubhaayo||
translation: Saying this she showed him her real form; then the prince thought that he should see that woman, who loves him;

gurmukhi: KYNc inKMg ksXo kt so Dnu cilby khu swj bnwXo ] dUqI ko sMg ley Apny ieh qw qRIX ilAwvn kwj isDwXo ]2202]
transliteration: Khainch Nikhanndkasyo Kat So Dhan(u) Lai Chal(i) Be Kauh Saaj Banaayo|| Dootiko San Lae Apne Eh Taa Treeya Liaavan Kaaj Sidhaayo||2202||
translation: He tied his bow in his waist and carrying the arrows he made up his mind to go; he accompanied the messenger to bring with him the woman in love.2202.
